Board game could be played by 5 players who represent 5 nations.
The games are arranged in the following order: Britain -> France -> Germany -> Russia -> Austria, up to 10 turns each.
Each turn, each players could place Political Factors (PF\'s) according to the amount specified in each nation.
The placing could be placed with no more than 5 PF\'s per location per turn except in the area of the nation, it could be placed according to the remaining PF\'s.
After placing the PF, players could choose to attack other players in any area once, but that area requires both attacker\'s PF\'s and defender\'s PF\'s.
The result of the attack would depend on the roll of the dice, and the ratio of PF\'s between the attacker and the defender.
In all location, once any player had at least 10 PF\'s, it would be got TREATY RIGHTS in that location.

After all players have played 10 turn, the game would count VICTORY POINTS from locations which received TREATY RIGHTS in accordance with the goals of each nation.\n The red numbers that mean EXCLUSIVE treaty rights only if no other nation has treaty right from that nation.
For some nations, there would be EXTRA victory points when players could complete the mission.
Players could select to play among themselves 5 people or choose to play with AI.
The players could choose the nation they would like to play or press the button to let the game randomly give nations.
For playing with AI, players could choose how many AI and the level of AI.
The games would be played in the order of nations according to the rules.
The game would show information of current players including the number of PF\'s that could be placed and the number of turns at that time.
Players could change the view to be a map or table at any time by pressing the button above to switch.
The game also shows an overview of the number of PF\'s in each location and would change colour to BLUE when any nation got TREATY RIGHTS on the table view.
To place PF\'s, players could choose to place anywhere by pressing the nation AREAS on the map view or the nation BUTTONS on the table view.
Players could specify the number of PF\'s to be placed in that area according to the rules by sliding the seek bar.
For attacking, players could choose the area as the same as placing. Also, players could choose other players who would be defender.
Before attack confirmation, the game would calculate the ratio of PF\'s between attacker and defender, then shows the probability that may occur.
After the attack was completed, the game would show the results of attacks between attacker and defender.
Players could decide to skip attack by pressing the END TURN button and press the UNDO button to reverse the placement (UNDO cannot be used for the attacking).
For the turn of AI, the game would summarize all actions in that turn and notify the players.
Players could click on the country FLAG or NAME at the top or the nation FLAG at the bottom to see the goals of each nations.
Players could press the dice on the top left to see the detail of DIPLOMATIC ATTACK.
After all players have completed 10 turns, the game would summarize the score and announce the winner.
